Package gw.api.policy.refresh

package gw.api.policy.refresh
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    gw.api.policy
     
    gw.api.policy.refresh.compare
     
    gw.api.policy.refresh.pcintegration
     
    gw.api.policy.refresh.relink
     
    gw.api.policy.refresh.ui
     
  • Class
    Description
    ContactPreservingFilter
    Encapsulates the logic for handling Contacts that will be removed or replaced as part of the policy refresh.
    CopyInternalFieldsFilter
    Copies all internal-only fields from the matched entities to the corresponding entities that will replace them in the Policy Refresh.
    DefaultMatcher
    The default matcher uses every non-link property to compare the two beans: if all property values are equal, then the entities match.
    IdPropertyMatchPrioritizer<T extends KeyableBean>
    A subclass of PropertyMatchPrioritizer to prioritize based on the PolicySystemId and AddressBookUID properties.
    MatcherContextFactory
    Factory for creating the MatcherContext from the given configuration.
    PolicyComparison
    Represents a comparison between two policies for purposes of populating a tree of entity comparison nodes, relinking non-policy graph entities back to the new policy, and deleting the old policy.
    PolicyExtractor
    Class for extracting a policy graph from an existing Claim/Policy.
    PolicyRefreshAlgorithm
    The PolicyRefreshAlgorithm keeps the internal state of the PolicyRefreshWizard, and acts as a coordinator for the various steps in the policy refresh as defined by the IPolicyRefreshPlugin.
    PolicyRefreshAlgorithm.RefreshStep
     
    PolicyRefreshBuilder
     
    PolicyRefreshConfiguration
    Encapsulates the parts of policy refresh that are customer configurable.
    PolicyRefreshUI
    Interface for building a UI for comparing two policies.
    PolicyRelinker
    Responsible for relinking: Any entities in the Claim (outside the policy graph) that are currently pointing to the old policy. Any entities in the old Policy that are currently pointing to entities outside the policy graph. The relinker must first determine which entities fit into these two categories and then make the appropriate changes to fix these links before the policy is replaced.
    RefreshDebugHelper
    Common methods for debugging Policy Refresh.
    RefreshFromPolicyFetcher
    Fetcher to use when refreshing from an existing policy without any risk unit selection
    RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher
    Refresh policy from a policy summary.
    RefreshPolicyFetcher
    Hides the details of how we fetch the policy from the PolicyRefreshAlgorithm.
